00020 } queery_set;
00021 typedef struct { 
00022         int a; // integer describing the class for this record name
00023         int b; // integer describing record type in class
00024         char m; /* Character to override modify flags */
00025         int n; /* the line number in the file */
00026         linefield f[25]; /* pointer to field */
00027         int ignore; /* if = 0 line already printed.  Ignore */
00028 } linedef;
00029 typedef struct {
00030         char c[50]; // for sets of short strings
00031 } charlist;
00032 
00033 typedef struct {
00034         char typ[100]; /* type of line -- padded for extra info.  Also
00035                         used for line rule designations. */
00036         int f; /* number of fields */
00037         /* Since the length of any one line is 80 characters, there can be,
00038         *         at most (one hopes) 80 fields.  */
00039         int c[80]; /* number of characters in field */
00040         /*fieldinfo fi[80];  change information for each field */
00041         int i; /* toggle -- 0 for no change information, 1 if exists.
00042                         Others designations can be added... */
00043         char t[80]; /* type of entry for each field:
00044         integer = i
00045         character = c
00046         string = s
00047         float = f
00048         double = d
00049         */
00050 } pdb_line_info;
00051 typedef struct {
00052 /* This structure defines a pdb line.  It defines it by class as given
00053   in the pdb format instructions.  Doing it this way allows rules to be
00054   set per class -- for example, one class should be present, at most, once
00055   in any pdb file.  */
00056         pdb_line_info b[25]; /* pointer to record type -- currently, there
00057                               are 22 record types in the most populated
00058                               class of records. */ 
00059         char r[50]; /* String containing a rule for this entire set of
00060                        lines. */
00061 } pdb_line;
00062 
00063 /* Begin declarations for amber line structure definitions */
00064 pdb_line pdb_a[6]; /* There are 6 record classes, currently (20051104)*/
00065 /* Begin declarations for modify-file rules.  The rules, for now, are limited
00066  * to rules involving HETATM entries.  Eventually, there will be more. */
00067 pdb_line mod_a[6];
00068 /* Pointer to a structure to keep track of user-specified modifications 
00069  * -- will be allocated in init_struct */

00071 /* Declare a pointer to a linedef.  This will be allocated in init_struct */
00072 linedef *ln;
